definitions.text: a telephone connection
examples: she reported several anonymous calls
he placed a phone call to London
he heard the phone ringing but didn't want to take the call

definitions.text: a special disposition (as if from a divine source) to pursue a particular course
examples: he was disappointed that he had not heard the Call

definitions.text: a loud utterance; often in protest or opposition
examples: the speaker was interrupted by loud cries from the rear of the audience

definitions.text: a demand especially in the phrase
examples: the call of duty

definitions.text: the characteristic sound produced by a bird
examples: a bird will not learn its song unless it hears it at an early age

definitions.text: a brief social visit
examples: senior professors' wives no longer make afternoon calls on newcomers
the characters in Henry James' novels are forever paying calls on each other, usually in the parlor of some residence

definitions.text: a demand by a broker that a customer deposit enough to bring his margin up to the minimum requirement
a demand for a show of hands in a card game
examples: after two raises there was a call

definitions.text: a request
examples: many calls for Christmas stories
not many calls for buggywhips

definitions.text: an instruction that interrupts the program being executed
examples: Pascal performs calls by simply giving the name of the routine to be executed

definitions.text: a visit in an official or professional capacity
examples: the pastor's calls on his parishioners
the salesman's call on a customer

definitions.text: (sports) the decision made by an umpire or referee
examples: he was ejected for protesting the call

definitions.text: the option to buy a given stock (or stock index or commodity future) at a given price before a given date
assign a specified (usually proper) proper name to
examples: They named their son David
The new school was named after the famous Civil Rights leader

definitions.text: ascribe a quality to or give a name of a common noun that reflects a quality
examples: He called me a bastard
She called her children lazy and ungrateful

definitions.text: get or try to get into communication (with someone) by telephone
examples: I tried to call you all night
Take two aspirin and call me in the morning

definitions.text: utter a sudden loud cry
examples: she cried with pain when the doctor inserted the needle
I yelled to her from the window but she couldn't hear me

definitions.text: order, request, or command to come
examples: She was called into the director's office
Call the police!

definitions.text: pay a brief visit
examples: The mayor likes to call on some of the prominent citizens

definitions.text: call a meeting; invite or command to meet
examples: The Wannsee Conference was called to discuss the `Final Solution'
The new dean calls meetings every week

definitions.text: read aloud to check for omissions or absentees
examples: Call roll

definitions.text: send a message or attempt to reach someone by radio, phone, etc.; make a signal to in order to transmit a message
examples: Hawaii is calling!
A transmitter in Samoa was heard calling

definitions.text: utter a characteristic note or cry
examples: bluejays called to one another

definitions.text: stop or postpone because of adverse conditions, such as bad weather
examples: call a football game

definitions.text: greet, as with a prescribed form, title, or name
examples: He always addresses me with `Sir'
Call me Mister
She calls him by first name

definitions.text: make a stop in a harbour
examples: The ship will call in Honolulu tomorrow

definitions.text: demand payment of (a loan)
examples: Call a loan

definitions.text: make a demand, as for a card or a suit or a show of hands
examples: He called his trump

definitions.text: give the calls (to the dancers) for a square dance
indicate a decision in regard to
examples: call balls and strikes behind the plate

definitions.text: make a prediction about; tell in advance
examples: Call the outcome of an election

definitions.text: require the presentation of for redemption before maturation
examples: Call a bond

definitions.text: challenge (somebody) to make good on a statement; charge with or censure for an offense
examples: He deserves to be called on that

definitions.text: declare in the capacity of an umpire or referee
examples: call a runner out

definitions.text: lure by imitating the characteristic call of an animal
examples: Call ducks

definitions.text: order or request or give a command for
examples: The unions called a general strike for Sunday

definitions.text: order, summon, or request for a specific duty or activity, work, role
examples: He was already called 4 times for jury duty
They called him to active military duty

definitions.text: utter in a loud voice or announce
examples: He called my name
The auctioneer called the bids

definitions.text: challenge the sincerity or truthfulness of
examples: call the speaker on a question of fact

definitions.text: consider or regard as being
examples: I would not call her beautiful

definitions.text: rouse somebody from sleep with a call
examples: I was called at 5 A.M. this morning
